intro: Wahlenbergia grandiflora var. lata, commonly known as the broad-leaved larkspur, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and can grow up to 60 cm in height. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
